snippet: South Korea’s intelligence service reported that Jang Song-thaek, considered to be No. 2 in the government and a mentor to Kim Jong-un, has been stripped of his powers.
abstract: South Korea’s intelligence service reports that Jang Song-thaek, uncle and mentor to North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, has been stripped of his powers; it is biggest in series of purges, promotions and reshufflings of elites that seem to have remade the government in the image of Kim, who inherited his title.

byline.original: By CHOE SANG-HUN and DAVID E. SANGER

lead_paragraph: South Korea’s intelligence service reported that Jang Song-thaek, considered to be No. 2 in the government and a mentor to Kim Jong-un, has been stripped of his powers.

headline.main: North Korea’s Leader Is Said to Oust Uncle in Power Play
headline.print_headline: North Korea’s Leader Is Said To Oust Uncle in Power Play
